thread.title: Murphy Lifts Mets to Advance to the NLCS
thread.title_full: Murphy Lifts Mets to Advance to the NLCS - WSJ

author: Jared Diamond
title: Murphy Lifts Mets to Advance to the NLCS
text:
1 COMMENTS Jacob deGrom didn’t have his best stuff but Daniel Murphy (pictured) made sure the Mets’ dream season didn’t end in Los Angeles.
Murphy’s dramatic sixth-inning home run lifted the Mets to a 3-2 win over the Dodgers on Thursday to advance to the National League Championship Series.
Before the homer that ultimately determined the outcome, Murphy drove in the contest’s first run with an RBI single in the first inning. Then in the fourth inning, he stole a run, taking an uncovered third base following a Lucas Duda walk, as the Dodgers’ infield—shifted toward right field with the lefty-swinging Duda at the plate—watched helplessly. He wound up scoring on a Travis d’Arnaud sacrifice fly.
DeGrom, who dazzled over seven shutout innings in Game 1 of this series, lacked command of his pitches in Game 5, but made the three runs stand up.
Noah Syndergaard pitched a scoreless seventh inning for the Mets. Closer Jeurys Familia closed out the game getting six outs for the save.
The Mets host the Chicago Cubs in Game 1 on the NLCS on Saturday night. The Cubs won all seven games that the two teams played this season.
—Jared Diamond
